fields.title: Experiment Search
fields.text:
Create Experiment
Creates a new empty experiment. To edit the experiment and add sessions, follow the link shown in the table.

Search
Searches for matching experiments with either a similar Title, Manager or Note.

Show All
Returns a list of all experiments. Note that this can take some time to compile.

Show Open
Returns a list of all experiments that have one or more sessions that are not complete. To complete a session, click the "Complete" button in the lower left corner. Subject that have incomplete sessions in their history may not recruit as expected or return a the expected earnings report.

Delete
Experiments that do not have any subjects recruited to them can be deleted. Experiments that you no longer wish to run that have subjects recruited should be canceled. Sessions can be canceled by following the link to the experiment and then the link to the session you wish to cancel.

fields.title: Experiment View
fields.text:
Experiment Parameters
  • Title: Unique name for your experiment.
  • Managers: Faculty members running experiments.
  • Length: Length in minutes that you need to run your experiment, including time payout at the end.
  • School: The school you are running at. This does not restrict recruitment.
  • Account: The financial services account your payouts will be charged to.
  • Show-up Fee: The amount paid to subjects simply for attending. This is also paid to bumped subjects.
  • Institution(s): Used when necessary to restrict recruitment to other experiments that do not want subjects with this type of experience. Institutions cannot be changed once a subject is attending.
  • Notes: An optional area to save information about this experiment
  • Recruitment Email: The email sent to subjects to invite them to session, there is a default email for both single and multi day experiments. Variables in the [xyz] brackets will be filled in automatically.
  • Reminder Email: Similar the the recruitment email, but is sent 24 hours before the start time of the session to remind the subject about the experiment.

Experiment Parameters (Default)
These parameters will be filled in by default when a new session is created, but can be changed within each individual session as needed.
  • Gender(s): Genders of subjects you wish to recruit. Note that a subject's gender is their self reported gender identity.
  • Subject Type(s): The current self reported enrollment status of subjects you wish to include.
  • Number of Participants: The number of subjects you need for a session.
  • Registration Cutoff: The maximum number of subjects that should be allowed to accept an invitation to a session.
  • Minimum / Maximum Experiment Experience: The inclusive number of other experiments a subject should have participated in already.
  • Enable Experience Constraint?: Enable or disable Experiment Experience constraint.
  • Allow subjects to participate more than once: If Yes, a subject can attend multiple sessions within this experiment.
  • Include / Exclude Institution Experience: Include or exclude subjects that have been in (or not) other experiments that have the specified institution.
  • Include / Exclude Experiment Experience: Include or Exclude subjects that have been in (or not) the experiments specified.
  • Exclude if in all / at least one: Include or Exclude subjects if they have been in all items specified or a subject the has been in at least one of the items specified.
  • Include / Exclude Subjects From Schools: Schools are automatically assigned to a subject based on email domain filters. For example, if Big University has the domain @BigU.edu, then all subjects with an @BigU.edu account would be included or excluded.
  • Enable school include / exclude: If filters are disabled all subjects are eligible.

Sessions
  • Add: Add a new session to this experiment.
  • Edit: Edit the individual session parameters and recruit subjects to the session.
  • Delete: If no subjects have been invited, a session can be deleted.

fields.title: Session View
fields.text:
Recruitment Parameters
Recruitment parameters can be changed on a session by session basis. Their initial values will be based on the default values set on the experiment setup page. After each recruitment invitation, the results will be stored in the Invitations table. For descriptions of each of the recruitment, parameters see the help doc for the experiment setup page. The "Allow subjects to participate more than once" parameter cannot be changed once a subject has accepted an invitation to the session.

Invite Subjects
  • Find: Randomly finds the specified number of subjects based on the recruitment parameters. The total number of eligible subjects will be shown at the bottom.
  • Clear: Clears the search result.
  • Invite: Sends the specified invitation email to the list of found subjects and adds them to the session. Note that the server can only send 1 or 2 emails per second, leave the form open until it has finished. There is no limit to the number of invitations that can be sent at once.

Send Message
Send an email to all subjects that have accepted the invitation. A list of attending subject emails is provided on this screen. A list of messages sent to the session is shown in the Messages table.

Manually Add Subject
Search for a single subject to add to the session. Once added, a subject must still accept the invitation in their account. A subject that is already in a session cannot be added again. A subject that has a recruitment violation cannot be added either. Recruitment violations could come from a subject not meeting this session's criteria. A violation could also come from a future commitment that would be violated by attending this session.

Cancel Session
Canceling a session sends an email to all subjects who are attending and prevents all other subjects from accepting the invitation.

Setup
  • Location: Room where the experiment takes place.
  • Date and Time: Date and Time of the session. A warning will be shown in the session table if this session overlaps with another. This cannot be changed once a subject has accepted.
  • Length in Minutes: The length of the experiment is minutes. Subjects are prohibited from accepting an invitation to sessions that overlap.
  • Account: The financial services account to charge the payouts to.
  • Send Reminder Email: If yes the attending subjects will receive a reminder email 24 hours before the start. If a new session is created and the start time is less than 20 hours from now, no reminder will be sent.
  • Enable Meeting Time: Require subjects to meet at a specific time for the session day. If disabled subjects can do the session day at any time on the date specified.

Subjects
  • Remove: Subjects who have not accepted can be removed from the session.
  • Confirm: Elevated staff users can manually confirm subjects if there is not recruitment violation.
  • Un-confirm: Elevated staff users can manually un-confirm a subject if they do not have any payouts specified on the run screen.
Run
Open the run screen.

fields.title: Run Session
fields.text:
Stripe Reader
Put the mouse cursor in box labeled "Cursor Here" then run a subject's ID card through the card reader. The subject's status will change from "No Show" to "Attended".

Automatically add subjects
Elevated users can automatically add valid users to a session with a card swipe.

Ignore recruitment constraints
When automatically adding users, this will ignore any recruitment violations and add the subject to the session.

Control
  • Bump: The subject is not needed for this session and should only be paid the Show-Up Fee.
  • No Show: The subject did not come to the experiment.
  • Attend: Elevated staff users can manually set a subject to "Attended".
Earnings
The amount of money the subject earned in the experiment.

On-Time Bonus
The amount of money the subject receives for being on-time, even if they are not used in the session.

Save Payouts
Save the payouts to the database. You will need to save before you complete and print the session results.

Fill All Earnings
Automatically fill in all attending subject's earnings with this amount.

Fill show-up fee
Automatically fill in the show-up fee with this amount.

Auto Bump
Randomly bump extra subjects. If a subject was bumped from their last session, they will not be auto bumped.

Bump All
Bump all attending subjects.

Complete Session
Once all of the payouts have been entered the session must be set to "complete". Sessions that are left open may cause problems with recruiting and financial reports.

Upload Earnings
Upload a CSV file containing subject earnings in the format of :
Student ID, Experiment Earnings, On-Time Bonus (optional)
Student ID, Experiment Earnings, On-Time Bonus (optional)
...
Elevated users will automatically add eligible subjects to the session.

Print Attendees
Show a printer friendly list of subjects that attended so subjects can sign for their payout.

Print Bumps
Show a printer friendly list of subjects that were bumped so subjects can sign for their payout.

PayPal Export
Export a PayPal formatted csv that can be upload to the PayPal mass payment system.

fields.title: User Search
fields.text:
Search
Search a user's name, email, ID number and account type for matching criteria.

Active and Confirmed
Limit search to users that are active and have confirmed their email address.

Email
Elevated users can send an email announcement to all active users.

Blackballs
Show all users who are black balled. Blackballed users will not be invited to experiments.

No-Show Blocks
Show all users who are currently blocked from receiving invitations because they failed to show up to experiments they committed to attend.

fields.title: User Info
fields.text:
Make Note
Leave a comment about the subject, for example , if the subject was blackballed then why?

Edit Subject
Elevated staff users can edit information about the subject. Only an account owner can change their password.

Upcoming Experiments
Future experiments the subject has committed to be in. A subject can leave a session if it is more than 24 hours away.

Experiments Attended
Past experiments this subject has attended or been bumped from.

Full Invitation List
All invitations this subjects has received. No shows are marked here.

Traits
The list of trait values collected for this subject and the date they were uploaded

fields.title: Reports
fields.text:
Petty Cash Reconciliation Sheet
  • Department: The department whos accounts will be tallied.
  • Start / End Date: The inclusive date range with which to do the tally.
Student Report
  • Subjects that are nonresident alien: Only include subjects that are marked as nonresident aliens.
  • Subjects earning at least $N in total: Only include subjects that have earned $N or more.
  • Student workers only: Only include subjects that have self reported as being a student worker.
  • Start / End Date: The inclusive date range with which to report on.

fields.title: Calendar
fields.text:
|<<| Current |>>|
Navigate to the previous, current and next month of the year.

Run Session
Click on a link to an experiment session to jump straight to its run session page.

More Info
Click on a calendar cell's date to see more information about that day's schedule.

Cancel Sessions
Canceled Sessions will be crossed out.

Anytime Sessions
These sessions can be done at anytime by the subjects on the specified day. A typical use case would be an asynchronous online experiment done outside of the lab.

fields.title: Profile
fields.text:
First Name
Given name

Last Name
Family name

Student ID
ID number from your student ID card, leave blank if you are a non-student.

Email Address
Only one account per email address can be created. You will be required to verify you have access to this email account.

Phone Number
Although unlikely, we may need to contact you quickly about the status of an experiment.

Gender identity
Choose the gender identity that most closely matches how you identify. If none of the listed identities matches closely to your own, choose "Other".

Major
Choose the major the most closely matches your current or completed college major. If you did not attend college choose "Undeclared".

Enrollment Status
Choose the college enrollment status best fits your situation.

Student Worker
Choose yes if you have been or are currently a student worker in this calendar year.

Pause Account
A paused account will no longer receive invitations. You can re-enable you account at any time.

Password
Passwords must be 8 characters long and have some complexity to them.

fields.title: Subject Home
fields.text:
Upcoming Experiments
List of upcoming experiments you have been invited to.

I want to attend
Check the date and length of the experiment. You must arrive early to check-in and be able to stay for the entire experiment.

I no longer wish to attend
You may leave the experiment if it does not start within 24 hours. If you repeatedly fail to show up for experiments you confirmed for, you will no longer be invited to future experiments.

Canceled Experiments
Sometimes we have to cancel experiments. You will receive an email notification if this happens. If an experiment is canceled no action is required on your part.

Ineligible Experiments
You may not be eligible to attend all possible combinations of experiments you are invited to. When you accept an invitation to one experiment session others may then be marked as ineligible. The most common reason for this is that you cannot participate in the same experiment more than once.

Anytime Experiments
An experiment that is marked as "Anytime" can be completed at any time on the date specified and will last, at most, the length of time specified.

Full Experiments
Once enough people have accepted an invitation, no additional subjects can accept.

Experiments Attended
A list of experiments you attended or were bumped from.

Full Invitation List
A list of every invitation you have received. No Shows are listed here. If you accept an invitation but fail to show up, you will be marked as a "No Show". If you repeatedly "No Show", you will no longer be invited to future experiments.

fields.title: Traits
fields.text:
Upload New Traits
File format:
num,studentid,fullname,traitname1,traitname2,...
1,1234,John Smith,2.1,3,...
2,5678,Jane Doe,-1,12,...

Trait values must be numeric. New traits will be automatically added. Old traits will be overwritten. A subject cannot have duplicate traits. A subject can have any subset of traits.
If a subject cannot be found, an error will be returned. The subject's student ID from the file must match what is in the database. If there are two subjects with the same student ID an error will be returned.

Mange Traits
Elevated users can manually add or remove traits.

Download Report
Select the desired traits and generate a report of all users that have a subset of the selected traits.
